RefParameter.Name: LL_NAME
RefParameter.Comment: Define the name of your Queue

RefParameter.Name: LL_MASTERDMA
RefParameter.Comment: DMA Channel to run the linked list

RefParameter.Name: LL_CIRCULARNODE
RefParameter.Comment: First Loop Node, name of the node

RefParameter.Name: LL_CIRCULARNODE
RefParameter.Comment: First Loop Node, name of the node

RefParameter.Name: NODE_NAME
RefParameter.Comment: Define the name of your node

PossibleValue.Comment: Right Aligned padded with 0 up to destination data width when src data width smaller than dest data width
Right Aligned Left Truncated down to destination data width when src data width bigger than dest data width
Right Aligned padded with sign extended up to destination data width when src data width smaller than dest data width
Left Aligned Right Truncated down to the destination data width when src data width bigger than dest data width
Packed at the destination data width when src data width smaller than dest data width
Unpacked at the destination data width when src data width bigger than dest data width
Trigger of the selected DMA request on the rising edge of the selected trigger event input
Trigger of the selected DMA request on the falling edge of the selected trigger event input
A block transfer is conditioned by (at least) one hit trigger
A repeated block transfer is conditioned by (at least) one hit trigger
A single/burst transfer is conditioned by (at least) one hit trigger
SPI6 IT OR SPI6 AIT SYNC
The TC (and the HT) event is generated at the (respectively half) end of each block
The TC (and the HT) event is generated at the (respectively half) end of the repeated block
The TC (and the HT) event is generated at the (respectively half) end of each linked-list item
The TC (and the HT) event is generated at the (respectively half) end of the last linked-list item
The TC (and the HT) event is generated at the (respectively half) end of each block
The TC (and the HT) event is generated at the (respectively half) end of each linked-list item
The TC (and the HT) event is generated at the (respectively half) end of the last linked-list item
Circular list looping on first transfer
Circular list looping on second transfer
